<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	DONLIN GOLD LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTE 1 &ndash; NATURE OF OPERATIONS AND ECONOMIC DEPENDENCE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	On December 1, 2007, Barrick Gold U.S. Inc. (&ldquo;Barrick&rdquo;)
	and NOVAGOLD Resources Alaska, Inc. (&ldquo;NOVAGOLD&rdquo;), formed Donlin Gold LLC, a Delaware limited liability corporation,
	(the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) to advance the Donlin Gold Project in Alaska. Each of Barrick and NOVAGOLD own a 50% interest in the
	Company. Donlin Gold LLC has a board of four directors, with two nominees selected by each company. All significant decisions related
	to Donlin Gold LLC require the approval of both companies. The Company currently depends on Barrick and NOVAGOLD for all of its
	funding and has received commitments from its shareholders that they will fund the Company for the next twelve months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	During the year ended November 30, 2016, the Company continued to
	advance permitting of the Donlin Gold Project. The Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors approved of the Project's Updated Feasibility
	Study in July 2012 and the Company subsequently submitted a Plan of Operations and the Wetlands Permit Application under Section
	404 of the U.S. Clean Water Act (CWA) to the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (the &ldquo;Corps&rdquo;), formally initiating the permitting
	process. This permit application triggered the start of the process of preparing an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) under
	the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The Corps, which is the lead agency for the NEPA process, filed the Notice of Availability
	of the draft EIS in the Federal Register in November 2015. Subsequent to the filing of the draft EIS, the Corps issued a schedule
	for public meetings on the Donlin Gold draft EIS in the Y-K region and Anchorage on the Donlin Gold EIS. The Corps conducted and
	at the end of May 2016 completed a six-month public comment period for the draft EIS, including 17 public comment meetings in communities
	across the Yukon-Kuskokwim region and in Anchorage. The Corps is reviewing the comments on the draft EIS and will respond to all
	comments in a final EIS which the Corps&rsquo; current schedule anticipates will be published in 2018.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTE 2 &ndash; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Presentation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	These Financial Statements are presented in United States dollars
	($) and have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (GAAP).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Use of estimates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The preparation of the Company&rsquo;s Financial Statements requires
	the Company to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the related disclosure
	of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the Financial Statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses
	during the reporting period. The more significant areas requiring the use of management estimates and assumptions relate to future
	cash flow estimates utilized in impairment calculations, when required, and environmental, reclamation and closure obligations.
	The Company bases its estimates on historical experience and on various other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under
	the circumstances. Accordingly, actual results will differ from amounts estimated in these financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Property and equipment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	On initial recognition, property and equipment are recorded at cost.
	Property and equipment are subsequently measured at cost less accumulated depreciation. Depreciation is recorded over the estimated
	useful life of the assets at the following annual rates:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	Computer equipment &ndash; 5 years straight line;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	Computer software &ndash; 5 years straight line;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	Furniture and equipment &ndash; 5 years straight line; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN">
	Leasehold improvements &ndash; straight-line over the lease
	term.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Depreciation methods, useful lives and residual values are reviewed
	at each financial year-end and adjusted if appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 98; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	A-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	6
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	DONLIN GOLD LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Mineral properties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	All direct costs related to the acquisition of mineral property
	interests are capitalized. Mineral property exploration expenditures are expensed when incurred. When it has been established that
	a mineral deposit is commercially mineable, an economic analysis has been completed in accordance with SEC Industry Guide 7 and&nbsp;permits
	are obtained, the costs subsequently incurred to develop a mine on the property prior to the start of mining operations are capitalized.
	Capitalized costs will be amortized following commencement of commercial production using the unit of production method over the
	estimated life of proven and probable reserves.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Asset retirement obligations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company records a liability based on the best estimate of costs
	for site closure and reclamation activities that the Company is legally or contractually required to undertake. The liability is
	estimated using expected cash flows based on engineering and environmental reports and accreted to full value over time through
	periodic charges to income. Adjustments to the reclamation obligation arising from changes in estimates are recorded as a component
	of the mineral property.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Income taxes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company is not a taxable entity for income tax purposes. Accordingly,
	no recognition is given to income taxes for financial reporting purposes. Tax on the net income (loss) of the Company is borne
	by the owners through the allocation of taxable income (loss). Net income for financial statement purposes may differ significantly
	from taxable income for the owners as a result of differences between the tax basis and financial reporting basis of assets and
	liabilities and the taxable income allocation requirements under the shareholders agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Impairment of long-lived assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Management assesses the possibility of impairment in the carrying
	value of its long-lived assets whenever events or circumstances indicate that the carrying amounts of the asset or assets group
	may not be recoverable. Management calculates the estimated undiscounted future net cash flows relating to the asset or assets.
	When the carrying value of an asset exceeds the related undiscounted cash flows, the asset is written down to its estimated fair
	value, which is usually determined using discounted future cash flows. Management&rsquo;s estimates of mineral prices, mineral
	reserves, foreign exchange rates, production levels and operating capital and reclamation costs are subject to risk and uncertainties
	that may affect the determination of the recoverability of the long-lived asset. It is possible that material changes could occur
	that may adversely affect management&rsquo;s estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Cash and cash equivalents
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Cash and cash equivalents consists of cash and highly liquid investments
	with original maturities of three months or less which are considered to be cash equivalents. The fair value of the Company&rsquo;s
	financial assets, which includes cash, approximates their carrying values at November 30, 2016 due to their short-term nature.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Trade payables
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The fair value of the Company&rsquo;s financial liabilities, such
	as accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximates their carrying values at November 30, 2016 due to their short-term nature.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Due to related parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The amounts due to Barrick are non-interest bearing, unsecured and
	without specified terms of repayment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	DONLIN GOLD LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Recently issued accounting pronouncements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In August 2016, Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) Accounting
	Standards Codification (ASC) guidance was issued to amend the classification of certain cash receipts and cash payments in the
	statement of cash flows. The new guidance is effective for the Company&rsquo;s fiscal year and interim periods beginning December
	1, 2018. Early adoption is permitted, including adoption in an interim period. If an entity early adopts the amendments in an interim
	period, any adjustments should be reflected as of the beginning of the fiscal year that includes that interim period. An entity
	that elects early adoption must adopt all of the amendments in the same period. The Company is currently evaluating this guidance
	and the impact on its consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Leases
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In February 2016, ASC guidance was issued to amend lease accounting
	guidance. The new guidance amends the recognition of lease assets and lease liabilities by lessees for those leases classified
	as operating leases and amends disclosure requirements associated with leasing arrangements. The new guidance is effective for
	the Company&rsquo;s fiscal year beginning December 1, 2019. Early adoption is permitted. The new standard must be adopted using
	a modified retrospective transition, and provides for certain practical expedients. Transition will require application of the
	new guidance at the beginning of the earliest comparative period presented. The Company is currently evaluating this guidance and
	the impact on its consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Presentation of Financial Statements &ndash; Going Concern
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In August 2014, ASC guidance was issued that explicitly requires
	management to assess an entity&rsquo;s ability to continue as a going concern, and to provide related footnote disclosures in certain
	circumstances. This standard is effective for the Company&rsquo;s fiscal year beginning December 1, 2016. The Company does not
	expect the updated guidance to have a material impact on the consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Donlin Gold Project is located in the Kuskokwim region of southwestern
	Alaska on private, Alaska Native-owned mineral and surface land and Alaska state mining claims. The property is under lease for
	subsurface mineral rights from Calista Corporation and surface land rights from The Kuskokwim Corporation, two Alaska Native corporations.
	The mineral property was jointly owned by Barrick and NOVAGOLD through an unincorporated joint venture prior to the formation of
	the Company. Upon formation of the Company the mineral property contributed was recorded based on the predecessor accounting values
	of Barrick and NOVAGOLD. As such, mineral property includes the historic acquisition cost as the partners&rsquo; initial contribution
	to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 100; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	A-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	8
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	DONLIN GOLD LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(U.S. dollars in thousands)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTE 5 &ndash; RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company received management services from Barrick for $1,978
	in 2016, $2,355 in 2015, and $2,618 in 2014. The Company received management services from NOVAGOLD for $235 in 2014. The charges
	are included in General and administrative expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company has accounts payable to Barrick at November 30, 2016
	of $119 (2015: $158) for reimbursement of management services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTE 6 &ndash; RECLAMATION AND REMEDIATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Although the ultimate amount of the reclamation costs to be incurred
	cannot be predicted with certainty, the total undiscounted amount of estimated cash flows required to settle the Company&rsquo;s
	estimated obligations for work undertaken at the site to date is $1,384. The amount has not been discounted due to the uncertainty
	of the timing of the reclamation activities due to the project&rsquo;s current permitting activities. Significant reclamation and
	closure activities include rehabilitation and decommissioning of the camp and drill sites.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	NOTE 7 &ndash; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	General
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company follows ASC guidance in determining its accruals and
	disclosures with respect to loss contingencies. Accordingly, estimated losses from loss contingencies are accrued by a charge to
	income when information available prior to issuance of the financial statements indicates that it is probable that a liability
	could be incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. Legal expenses associated with the contingency are expensed
	as incurred. If a loss contingency is not probable or reasonably estimable, disclosure of the loss contingency is made in the financial
	statements when it is at least reasonably possible that a material loss could be incurred. Management has identified no loss contingencies
	that meet the recognition criteria.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Obligations under operating leases
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Company leases certain assets, such as mineral property, land,
	office facilities and equipment, under operating leases. Mineral property and land leases coincide with the currently projected
	Donlin Gold mine life, with provisions for a further extension, should production continue beyond that. Office facilities and equipment
	leases expire at various dates through 2020. Future minimum annual lease payments are $1,877 in 2017, $1,578 in 2018, $1,578 in
	2019 and $1,578 in 2020 totaling $6,611.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #AB965E; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Independent Auditor&rsquo;s Report
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	To the Partners of the Galore Creek Partnership
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	We have audited the accompanying financial statements of the Galore Creek Partnership
	(the&nbsp;Partnership), which comprise the balance sheets as at December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015 and the statements of loss
	and comprehensive loss, changes in partners&rsquo; equity and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December
	31, 2016, and the related notes, which comprise a summary of significant accounting policies and other explanatory information.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Management&rsquo;s responsibility for the financial statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of these financial
	statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, as issued by the International Accounting Standards
	Board (IASB), and for such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements
	that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Auditor&rsquo;s responsibility
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our
	audits. We conducted our audits in accordance with Canadian generally accepted auditing standards and the standards of the Public
	Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable
	assurance about whether the financial statements are free from material misstatement. Canadian generally accepted auditing standards
	also require that we comply with ethical requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit evidence, on a test basis, about
	the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. The procedures selected depend on the auditor&rsquo;s judgment, including
	the assessment of the risks of material misstatement of the financial statements, whether due to fraud or error. We were not engaged
	to perform an audit of the Partnership&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting. Our audits included consideration of
	internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances,
	but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Partnership&rsquo;s internal control over financial
	reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An audit also includes evaluating the appropriateness of accounting principles
	and policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation
	of the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained in our audits is sufficient and appropriate
	to provide a basis for our audit opinion on the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Opinion
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In our opinion, the financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the
	financial position of Galore Creek Partnership as at December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015 and its financial performance and
	its cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December 31, 2014 in accordance with International Financial
	Reporting Standards, as issued by the IASB.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	signed &ldquo;PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP&rdquo;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Chartered Professional Accountants
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
</P>

	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<B>
	Galore Creek Partnership
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<B>
	December 31, 2016
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	(in Canadian dollars)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	1
</TD>
<TD>
	Nature of Operations and Economic Dependence
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The Galore Creek Partnership (&ldquo;Partnership&rdquo;) is a general partnership
	formed under the laws of the Province of British Columbia on August 1, 2007 for the purposes of exploration, development and construction
	of the Galore Creek mine. The Partnership is 50% owned by NovaGold Canada Inc. (&ldquo;NovaGold&rdquo;), a wholly owned subsidiary
	of NOVAGOLD RESOURCES INC. and 50% owned by Teck Resources Limited (&ldquo;Teck&rdquo;). The Partnership owns 100% of Galore Creek
	Mining Corporation, which is the operator of the project.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The Partnership&rsquo;s registered office is at 595 Burrard Street, Vancouver,
	British Columbia, Canada.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Upon formation of the Partnership, NovaGold contributed the Galore Creek project
	and Teck committed to contribute cash. Teck completed its cash earn-in obligation in 2011. NovaGold and Teck (collectively the
	&ldquo;Partners&rdquo;) are currently equally responsible for funding the Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	These financial statements have been prepared on the basis of accounting principles
	applicable to a going concern, which assumes that the Partnership will be able to continue in operation for the foreseeable future
	and will be able to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Currently, the Partnership is economically dependent upon its Partners, NovaGold
	and Teck, for financial support and the Partnership has commitments from its partners that it will receive support for the next
	12 months. The future recoverability of the Partnership&rsquo;s mineral property, plant and equipment is dependent upon: the ability
	of the Partnership to obtain continued support from its Partners or to obtain financing necessary to complete the development of
	its property, the existence of economically recoverable reserves, the securing and maintaining of title and beneficial interest
	in the properties, and the future profitable production or proceeds from disposition of the mineral properties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	2
</TD>
<TD>
	Basis of Preparation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	These annual financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International
	Financial Reporting Standards (&ldquo;IFRS&rdquo;) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (&ldquo;IASB&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	These financial statements were prepared by management and approved by the
	Partnership Management Committee on January 20, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	These annual financial statements include the results of the Partnership and
	its wholly owned subsidiary, Galore Creek Mining Corporation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 108; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</B>
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<B>
	December 31, 2016
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<I>
	(in Canadian dollars)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	3
</TD>
<TD>
	New IFRS Pronouncements
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	New IFRS pronouncements
	that have been issued but are not yet effective are listed below. The Partnership plans to apply the new standards in the annual
	period for which it is first required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	IFRS 9, Financial Instruments (IFRS 9), addresses the classification, measurement
	and recognition of financial assets and financial liabilities and supersedes the guidance relating to the classification and measurement
	of financial instruments in IAS 39, Financial Instruments: Recognition and Measurement (IAS 39).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	IFRS 9 requires financial assets to be classified into three measurement categories
	on initial recognition: those measured at fair value through profit and loss, those measured at fair value through other comprehensive
	income and those measured at amortized cost. Investments in equity instruments are required to be measured by default at fair value
	through profit or loss. However, there is an irrevocable option to present fair value changes in other comprehensive income. Measurement
	and classification of financial assets is dependent on the entity&rsquo;s business model for managing the financial assets and
	the contractual cash flow characteristics of the financial asset. For financial liabilities, the standard retains most of the IAS
	39 requirements. The main change is that, in cases where the fair value option is taken for financial liabilities, the part of
	a fair value change relating to an entity&rsquo;s own credit risk is recorded in other comprehensive income rather than the income
	statement, unless this creates an accounting mismatch.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	IFRS 9 is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018,
	with early adoption permitted. The Partnership does not expect the adoption of this standard to have a significant impact on its
	financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<B>
	Leases
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	On January 14, 2016, the IASB issued IFRS 16, Leases. &nbsp;This new standard
	replaces the existing leasing guidance in IAS 17, Leases. &nbsp;The objective of the new standard is to report all leases on the
	balance sheet and to define how leases and lease liabilities are measured. &nbsp;IFRS 16 is effective January 1, 2019 with early
	application permitted for companies that also apply IFRS 15. &nbsp;The Partnership is currently assessing the impact of IFRS 16
	on its financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	4
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	The significant accounting policies used in the preparation of these financial
	statements are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
<B>
	Mineral property, plant and equipment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	Plant and equipment is recorded at cost, being the purchase price and the directly
	attributable costs to bring the assets to the location and condition necessary for it to be capable of operating in the manner
	intended by management. Mobile road building equipment is depreciated over its estimated useful life of 3 years on a straight line
	basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 109; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	B-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	8
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<B>
	Galore Creek Partnership
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<B>
	December 31, 2016
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	(in Canadian dollars)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
	4
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (cont&rsquo;d)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Exploration and evaluation costs
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	Exploration and evaluation costs are considered to be tangible assets, as
	they relate to the Galore Creek property for which resources exist and it is expected that the expenditures can be recovered by
	future exploitation or sale. These assets are not depreciated, as they are not currently available for use. When development is
	approved, capitalized exploration and evaluation costs will be reclassified to development costs or capital work-in-progress within
	property, plant and equipment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Exploration and evaluation
	expenditures include property acquisition costs, engineering studies, drilling, survey work, capitalized construction costs relating
	to the advancement of the Galore Creek Project, mobile equipment depreciation and other costs related to the evaluation of the
	mineral resource. These costs will be transferred to work in progress once development is approved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Mine development costs will be amortized on a unit-of production basis once
	the asset is in the location and condition necessary for it to be capable of operating in the manner intended by the Partnership.
	Mobile construction equipment was amortized to exploration and evaluation costs over the estimated remaining useful life of the
	equipment. The amortization of the equipment was capitalized, as the equipment is required for continued development of the project.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Repairs and maintenance
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	Repairs and maintenance costs are charged to expense as incurred, except when
	these repairs significantly extend the life of an asset or result in an operating improvement. In these instances the portion of
	these repairs relating to the betterment is capitalized as part of plant and equipment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Impairment of tangible assets
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The carrying amounts of non-current assets are reviewed for impairment whenever
	facts and circumstances suggest that the carrying amounts may not be recoverable. For exploration &amp; evaluation assets, impairment
	indicators specific to exploration and evaluation assets are assessed. If there are indicators of impairment, the recoverable amount
	of the asset is estimated in order to determine the extent of any impairment. Where the asset does not generate cash flows that
	are independent from other assets, the recoverable amount of the cash generating unit (&ldquo;CGU&rdquo;) to which the asset belongs
	is determined. The recoverable amount of an asset or CGU is determined as the higher of its fair value less cost to sell and its
	value in use. An impairment loss exists if the asset&rsquo;s or CGU&rsquo;s carrying amount exceeds the recoverable amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Value in use is determined as the present value of the future cash flows expected
	to be derived from an asset or CGU. The estimated future cash flows are discounted to their present value using a pre-tax discount
	rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the CGU for which estimates
	of future cash flows have not been adjusted. Fair value less cost to sell is the amount obtainable from the sale of an asset or
	CGU in an arm&rsquo;s length transaction between knowledgeable, willing parties, less the costs of disposal. For mining assets,
	fair value less cost to sell is often estimated using a discounted cash flow approach as a fair value from an active market or
	binding sale agreement is not readily available. Estimated future cash flows are calculated using estimated future prices, mineral
	reserves and resources, operating and capital costs. All assumptions used are those that an independent market participant would
	consider appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 110; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	B-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	9
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<B>
	Galore Creek Partnership
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	Notes to Financial Statements
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<B>
	December 31, 2016
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	(in Canadian dollars)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	4
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (cont&rsquo;d)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.3PT">
<B>
	Provisions
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Decommissioning and restoration provisions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Future obligations to retire an asset, including dismantling, remediation
	and ongoing treatment and monitoring of the site related to normal operations are initially recognized and recorded as a provision
	based on estimated future cash flows. The decommissioning and restoration provision (&ldquo;DRP&rdquo;) is adjusted at each reporting
	period for changes to factors including the expected amount of cash flows required to discharge the liability, the timing of such
	cash flows and the discount rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	The DRP will be accreted to full value over time through periodic charges
	to earnings. This unwinding of the discount will be charged to financing expense in the statement of loss and comprehensive loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	The amount of the DRP initially recognized is capitalized as part of the related
	asset&rsquo;s carrying value and amortized to earnings once production commences. The method of amortization follows that of the
	underlying asset. The costs related to a DRP are only capitalized to the extent that the amount meets the definition of an asset
	and can bring about future economic benefit. A revision in estimates or a new disturbance will result in an adjustment to the provision
	with an offsetting adjustment to the capitalized retirement cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Other provisions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Provisions are recognized when a present legal or constructive obligation
	exists, as a result of past events, and it is probable that an outflow of resources that can be reliably estimated will be required
	to settle the obligation. Where the effect is material, the provision is discounted using an appropriate current market-based pre-tax
	discount rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The Partnership recognizes financial assets and liabilities on the balance
	sheet when the Partnership becomes a party to the contractual provisions of the instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
<I>
	Cash and cash equivalents
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	Cash and cash equivalents consist of cash on deposit with banks and highly
	liquid short-term interest-bearing investments with maturities of 90 days or less from the original date of acquisition. Cash and
	cash equivalents are classified as loans and receivables.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
<I>
	Due from / (to) Partners
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The amounts due from / (to) Partners are non-interest bearing, unsecured and
	without specified terms of repayment. Due from / (to) Partners balances are classified as loans and receivables.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
<I>
	Trade receivables and payables
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	Trade receivables and payables are classified as loans and receivables. Loans
	and receivables are initially recorded at fair value with subsequent measurement at amortized cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 111; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->

	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	(in Canadian dollars)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	5
</TD>
<TD>
	Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (cont&rsquo;d)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Reclamation bonds
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The Partnership&rsquo;s held-to-maturity reclamation deposits are carried
	at cost and bear fixed interest rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Due to NovaGold Canada Inc.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The amount due to NovaGold Canada Inc. is a non-interest bearing payable and
	is recorded at amortized cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
<B>
	Income Taxes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -22.3PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 44.6PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	The Partnership is not a taxable entity for federal and provincial income tax
	purposes. Accordingly, no recognition is given to income taxes for financial reporting purposes. Tax on the Partnership&rsquo;s
	net income (loss) is borne by the Partners through the allocation of taxable income (loss). Net income for financial statement
	purposes may differ significantly from taxable income for the Partners as a result of differences between the tax basis and financial
	reporting basis of assets and liabilities and the taxable income allocation requirements under the Galore Creek Partnership Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	6
</TD>
<TD>
	Critical Accounting Estimates and Judgments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In preparing these financial
	statements, the Partnership makes estimates and judgements that affect the amounts recorded. Actual results could differ from those
	estimates. The estimates and judgements are based on historical experience and other factors the Partnership considers to be reasonable,
	including expectations of future events. The estimates and assumptions that could result in a material impact to the carrying amounts
	of assets and liabilities are outlined below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Exploration and Evaluation expenditure
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	The application of the Company&rsquo;s accounting policy for exploration and
	evaluation expenditures requires judgement in the following areas:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
<I>
	(i)
</I>
</TD>
<TD>
	Determination of whether any impairment indicators exist at each reporting date giving consideration to factors such as budgeted
	expenditures on the Galore Creek Property, assessment of the right to explore in the specific area and evaluation of any project
	specific and market data which would indicate that the carrying amount of exploration and evaluation assets is not recoverable;
	and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD>
	Assessing when the commercial viability and technical feasibility of the project has been determined, at which point the asset
	is reclassified to property and equipment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
<I>
	Decommissioning and Restoration Provisions
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	The DRP is based on cost estimates using information available at the balance
	sheet date. The DRP requires other significant estimates and assumptions such as: requirements of the relevant legal and regulatory
	framework, and the timing, extent and costs of required decommissioning and restoration activities. To the extent the actual costs
	differ from these estimates, adjustments will be recorded.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22.5PT">
</P>

</TD>
<TD>
	Mineral property, plant and equipment
</TD>

	Cost
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.5PT SOLID; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1.5PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.5PT SOLID; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1.5PT SOLID">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
	8
</TD>
<TD>
	Decommissioning and Restoration Provision
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD>
	Reclamation provision
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	Although the ultimate amount of the reclamation costs to be
	incurred cannot be predicted with certainty, the total undiscounted amount of estimated cash flows required to settle the Partnership&rsquo;s
	estimated obligations is $14.7 million. Significant reclamation and closure activities include land rehabilitation, decommissioning
	of roads, bridges, buildings and facilities at the project site.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	The reclamation liabilities may be subject to change based
	on changes in management&rsquo;s estimates, changes in remediation technology or changes to the applicable laws and regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
	b)
</TD>
<TD>
	Reclamation bonds
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.6IN">
	Each of the Partners has provided collateral for their 50% share of reclamation
	bonds and letters of credit covering the required permits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 22PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.6IN">
	At December 31, 2016 NovaGold funded $4.5 million of its share in respect of
	the BC Ministry of Forests and Range Special Use Permit (&ldquo;Forestry Act Permit&rdquo;), through the Partnership. The $4.5
	million loan related to the funding of these reclamation bonds will be repaid to NovaGold once the reclamation bond in respect
	of the Forestry Act Permit is released back to the Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.6IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	10
</TD>
<TD>
	Commitments and contingencies
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.3PT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD>
	Operating lease commitments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.35PT">
	The Partnership is party to certain operating leases. These operating leases
	include the Partnership&rsquo;s leased office location and certain office equipment. The future minimum lease payments as at December
	31, 2016 are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 90%; MARGIN-LEFT: 45.35PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
	b)
</TD>
<TD>
	The Partnership has a royalty agreement entitling the counterparty to a maximum annual net smelter royalty of between 0.5%
	to 1.0%. The royalty is subject to positive future operating mine cash flow and is contingent upon reaching certain agreed financial
	targets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	11
</TD>
<TD>
	Related party transactions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
	a)
</TD>
<TD>
	Management services
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	During the period ended December 31, 2016, NovaGold and Teck provided the Partnership
	with management services totaling $459,601 (2015 - $419,233; 2014 - $416,293) and $449,940 (2015 - $564,344; 2014 - $568,920),
	respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3IN">
	b)
</TD>
<TD>
	Due to Partners
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	As at December 31, 2016 the Partnership owed $35,703 (2015 - $35,249) to NovaGold
	and $448,779 (2015 - $1,107,051) to Teck for management services and expenses paid on the Partnership&rsquo;s behalf.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	In addition, the Partnership was owed $43,062 (2015 - $17,294) by Teck subsidiaries
	for management services provided to other Teck projects by staff of the Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	The Partnership owed $4.5 million (2015 - $4.5 million) to NovaGold in respect
	of its funding of reclamation bonds held in the Partnership.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.6PT">
	12
</TD>
<TD>
	Financial instruments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	Financial assets are comprised of cash and cash equivalents and reclamation
	bonds. Cash and cash equivalents and reclamation bonds are held with Canadian chartered banks.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	Financial liabilities are comprised of accounts payable and accrued liabilities,
	due to partners and due to NovaGold Canada Inc. All financial liabilities are due within 30 days, except the payable to NovaGold.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	The Partnership is not subject to material market risk on any of its financial
	instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	The fair value of the Partnership&rsquo;s accounts receivable, accounts payable
	and amounts due from / (to) partners approximate their carrying values at December 31, 2016 due to their short-term nature. Reclamation
	deposits are interest bearing deposits are held in interest bearing accounts and approximate fair value. These deposits effectively
	secure the amount due to NovaGold Canada Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.3IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	B-12
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	THIS AMENDMENT AGREEMENT dated December
	15, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</P>

	&rdquo;)

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(the &ldquo;
<B>
	Executive
</B>
	&rdquo;)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	WHEREAS:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	A.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Novagold and the Executive entered into a written contract of employment dated September 4, 2012
	(the &ldquo;Canadian Agreement&rdquo;).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	B.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Novagold USA and the Executive entered into a written contract of employment also dated September
	4, 2012 (the &ldquo;US Agreement&rdquo;).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	C.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Novagold, Novagold USA and the Executive have mutually agreed to amend certain terms of the Canadian
	Agreement and the US Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	NOW THEREFORE THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSES
	that in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, the parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	1.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
	Effective January 1, 2017 the Executive shall dedicate 75% of his working time to providing services to Novagold and Novagold
	USA.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	2.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
	The Executive shall provide Novagold and Novagold USA with a rolling 4 week schedule indicating 15 of each 20 work days
	he will provide services to Novagold and Novagold USA. It is understood that this schedule may be subject to change based on the
	business needs of Novagold and Novagold USA. It is also understood that the Executive will address time sensitive matters on days
	where he may not be scheduled to provide services to Novagold and Novagold USA.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	3.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
	During the terms of this Amendment Agreement, the Executive shall be paid 75% of his annual salary as set out in the Canadian
	Agreement and US Agreement, as adjusted from time to time. It is also understood the Executive
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&rsquo;
</FONT>
	s
	entitlement to any payment under the Annual Incentive Program will be adjusted to reflect his reduced scope of work.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
